ACC_001.message: "img" or "area" HTML element has no "alt" attribute.
ACC_001.explanation: All meaningful non-text content that is presented to the user should have a textual alternative that describes the content. The "alt" attribute can be used for "img" and "area" HTML elements.

ACC_002.message: "input" HTML element is not referenced by a corresponding label element.
ACC_002.explanation: Labels that identify the controls in a form should be used so that users know what input data is expected.

ACC_003.message: Non-text html elements should include a "title" attribute for accessibility.

ACC_005.message: Table heading cells should be identified by "th" elements for accessibility.

ACC_006.message: Tables should include a "thead" element for accessibility.

ACC_007.message: Content Documents do not use "epub:type" attributes for semantic inflection.

ACC_008.message: Navigation Document has no "landmarks nav" element.
ACC_008.explanation: Landmarks are convenient for users to quickly jump from one part of the content to another. Their presence facilitates the use by people with access problems to the content.

ACC_009.message: MathML should either have an "alttext" attribute or "annotation-xml" child element.
ACC_009.explanation: All meaningful non-text content that is presented to the user should have a textual alternative that describes the content. The "alttext" attribute or "annotation-xml" child element can be used for MathML content.

ACC_010.message: Headings should not be used within blockquote and figure elements.

ACC_011.message: SVG hyperlinks should have a human-readable title (using the "title" child element or the "xlink:title" attribute).
ACC_011.explanation: Visual interactive content that is presented to the user should have a textual alternative. The "title" child element or the "xlink:title" attribute can be used for SVG links.

ACC_012.message: Table elements should include a caption element.

ACC_013.message: Content file contains at least one inline style declaration.
ACC_013.explanation: Inline styles in HTML code almost always overwrite externally linked style sheets, including custom, user-defined style sheets that can help visually impaired people adapt content to their needs (enlarged fonts, color scheme, etc.). For this reason, the use of embedded styles should be avoided.

suggestions.ACC_013_SUG: Inline styles are not compatible with accessibility settings and display personalization. Use CSS Styles instead.

ACC_014.message: Value of CSS property "font-size" does not use a relative size: "%1$s"
ACC_014.explanation: The use of fixed units of measurement can create problems with some reading solutions when the user changes the font size and line-height settings, making the content unreadable. It is suggested to always use relative units of measure.

suggestions.ACC_014_SUG: Acceptable values include percentages, em multiples, "larger", "smaller", "normal" or "inherit".

ACC_015.message: Value of CSS property "line-height" does not use a relative size.
ACC_015.explanation: The use of fixed units of measurement can create problems with some reading solutions when the user changes the font size and line-height settings, making the content unreadable. It is suggested to always use relative units of measure.

suggestions.ACC_015_SUG: Acceptable values include percentages, numeric multiples, em multiples, "normal", or "inherit".

ACC_016.message: Value of CSS property "font-size" should use a relative size: "%1$s"
ACC_016.explanation: The use of fixed units of measurement can create problems with some reading solutions when the user changes the font size and line-height settings, making the content unreadable. It is suggested to always use relative units of measure.

suggestions.ACC_016_SUG: Acceptable values include percentages, em multiples, "larger", "smaller", "normal" or "inherit".

ACC_017.message: Value of CSS property "line-height" does not use a relative size.
ACC_017.explanation: The use of fixed units of measurement can create problems with some reading solutions when the user changes the font size and line-height settings, making the content unreadable. It is suggested to always use relative units of measure.

suggestions.ACC_017_SUG: Acceptable values include percentages, numeric multiples, em multiples, "normal", or "inherit".

suggestions.CSS_011_SUG: Consider merging CSS files to reduce the number of CSS files.

CSS_012.message: Document links to multiple CSS files.

CSS_019.message: CSS font-face declaration has no attributes.

CSS_020.message: CSS font selector declaration uses unexpected font-size value "%1$s".

suggestions.CSS_020_SUG: Acceptable values include percentages, em multiples, "larger", "smaller", "normal" or "inherit".

CSS_021.message: Shorthand CSS property "font-family" specifies an invalid System Font.

CSS_022.message: CSS selector specifies global margin setting.

CSS_025.message: CSS class Selector could not be found.

suggestions.CSS_025_SUG: Check for typos or define a class selector to document the use of the class.

HTM_002.message: The installed xml parser doesn’t support xml version verification. Xml files must be a valid XML 1.0 document.

HTM_007.message: Empty or whitespace-only value of attribute ssml:ph.

HTM_021.message: Content file doesn’t contain lang attribute.

HTM_022.message: Document may contain excessive DIV or SPAN tags.

suggestions.HTM_022_SUG: Merge DIV or SPAN tags when they are consecutive and use the same style.

HTM_023.message: An invalid XHTML Named Entity was found: "%1$s".

suggestions.HTM_023_SUG: Check the spelling or use numbered entities instead.

HTM_024.message: An XHTML Named Entity was found. Only "&" "'" ""e;" "<" or ">" are allowed.

suggestions.HTM_024_SUG: Check the spelling or use numbered entities instead.

HTM_025.message: Non-registered URI scheme type found in href.

suggestions.HTM_027_SUG: Lists should have more than one item for accessibility.

HTM_028.message: Input html elements should include an id.

HTM_029.message: Label html elements should include a "for" attribute referencing the id of an input element.

HTM_033.message: HTML "head" element does not have a "title" child element.

HTM_038.message: Ensure b, i, em, and strong elements are used in compliance with W3C HTML5 directives.

suggestions.HTM_038_SUG: CSS styles are usually more appropriate for italics or bold text.

HTM_044.message: Namespace uri "%1$s" was included but not used.

suggestions.HTM_045_SUG: Empty hrefs are valid self-references.  These should be validated to ensure that this is the desired intent.

HTM_046.message: Fixed format item has no viewport defined.

suggestions.HTM_046_SUG: A viewport declaration is required for fixed format items.

HTM_047.message: Html viewport is missing height and/or width.

suggestions.HTM_047_SUG: The viewport declaration must declare both width and height.

HTM_048.message: SVG Fixed-Layout Documents must have a "viewBox" attribute (on the outermost "svg" element).

HTM_049.message: Html element does not have an xmlns set to "http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml".

suggestions.HTM_049_SUG: Add xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" to the html element.

NAV.area: NAV EPUB v3 Table of contents

NAV_001.message: The nav file is not supported for EPUB v2.

NAV_003.message: The Navigation Document must have a page list when content document(s) contain page breaks (epub:type="pagebreak").

NAV_004.message: The Navigation Document should contain the full document heading hierarchy in EDUPUB.

NAV_005.message: Content documents contain "audio" elements but the Navigation Document does not have a listing of audio clips (epub:type="loa").

NAV_006.message: Content documents contain "figure" elements but the Navigation Document does not have a listing of figures (epub:type="loi").

NAV_007.message: Content documents contain "table" elements but the Navigation Document does not have a listing of tables (epub:type="lot").
